channel.title: Need Help with a 10 minute timer
channel.description: Can anyone help me create a 10 minute timer for my PK Tournament? How do i make it so every ten minutes a new round starts automaticly?

item.title: Need Help with a 10 minute timer
item.dc:creator: @viruz_3 viruz 3
item.description:
@viruz_3 wrote:

[quote=“BurnInSilence, post:4, topic:178543”]nope lol, here
60 X 10 = 600
thats normally how many seconds you have in 10 minutes
but since your timer will be getting subtracted by 1 every half second, it would normally be 5 minutes untill it reaches 0
so 600 X 2, to make it be the full extent of 10
is 1200
public int TIMER = 1200;
if(TIMER > 0)
TIMER -= 1;[/quote]
Thank You soooo much man!

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help with a 10 minute timer

item.title: Need Help with a 10 minute timer
item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence
item.description:
@BurnInSilence wrote:

nope lol, here
60 X 10 = 600
thats normally how many seconds you have in 10 minutes
but since your timer will be getting subtracted by 1 every half second, it would normally be 5 minutes untill it reaches 0
so 600 X 2, to make it be the full extent of 10
is 1200
public int TIMER = 1200;
if(TIMER > 0)
TIMER -= 1;

item.title: Need Help with a 10 minute timer
item.dc:creator: @viruz_3 viruz 3
item.description:
@viruz_3 wrote:

So i should multiply 10 minutes in seconds by 2?

item.title: Need Help with a 10 minute timer
item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence
item.description:
@BurnInSilence wrote:

yeah, ok boolean process is called every half second, so
Seconds in 10 minutes X 2 = what your timer should be
=P

Read full topic
